Reviews.Title: “Amazing, I am pissed off that I didn't stay here based on other reviews”
Reviews.Author: Tyww
Reviews.Content: I am really pissed off that I didn't stay here earlier based on other reviews. There is Internet, one of the most re Isabel I've used in any hotel in playa del Carmen. It is so quiet it's creepy, I don't understand why other users had said that there is any noise at all. I don't even hear anyone else at the condotel. there is vast beautiful open spaces within the condo for relaxation. The location is amazing, next to the beach. I even have ocean view. I think it really depends on who you rent from. I rented from aldea vacations. I will try mystic tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Was worried due to reviews but had a lovely time...”
Reviews.Author: djjbtoronto
Reviews.Content: My partner and I travelled here Feb 2-10, 2012. I carefully read all the reviews about the property and was a bit concerned by some of the negative reviews. However, we chose to keep our booking. We booked through the Mistik property management (www.aldeathai.com.mx/us) website. They were very responsive to our questions prior to our travel. The property has a mix of condo owners who live in their condos and others who rent out their condos. Not all owners use the Mistik property management company. We met our neighbours who owned and lived in their suite - they were quite friendly. The location of the hotel is great, Kool beach and Mamitas beach clubs are steps away. Our rate included breakfast at either place (Kool beach's was better than Mamita's) and chairs/umbrella at those beach clubs. The suite itself was nice and spacious, like a mid grade finish to a modern N American condo. The big pros to the property are the location, that it is modern, the suites are large, and ours was well maintained and kept very clean (Suite 240). The condo pool is lovely. I thought the property itself was well maintained (pool, poolside chairs, lobby, etc.). The cons are that the internet bandwith is POOR, and I needed to use the internet (despite being on holiday I still had to check in with work for about 1/2 hour/day). The speed of the wireless was at times like dial up which was a big time waster, although I could waste it by the pool. Our bathroom was treacherous, the whole bathroom gets wet and there is no way to prevent it. While not a problem for us, if someone had some mobility issues it would have been a serious problem. The AC was loud but worked very well. This property, because of its mix of owners and renters, is not run like a typical hotel. You're more or less on your own, but other than the internet we had a few small issues that were quickly resolved by the Mistik property management people. I thought they did a great job. I would stay here again. I think users who post on this property should identify their suite and the booking agency they used because my sense is that the experience is quite variable depending on the property management company involved. I am not sure I would classify the hotel as a "luxury condohotel" and the level of service is not similar to that of any luxury hotel I have stayed in. It's good, but not luxury.

Reviews.Title: “BAD EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: RiSssa
Reviews.Content: #1 Hotel is on a unpaved road with huge craters of puddles after a it rains, average sedan would get stuck. It feels like you are entering a junkyard. #2 Air conditioning was not working. The room is like a sauna, with no ventilation. Forget about if you had an asthma attack, you can not even breathe with even normal lungs. No repairman on site to fix this. #3 Internet was not working. No repairman on site was able to fix this either. #4 No available manager at night to manage the above problems. An arrogant receptionist as the face of the company over night. Has little interest in the complaints stated above stated to us: he does not have the number to the hotel and I must wait until the manager comes in at 10 AM. Are you kidding me? No compassion nor customer service. Granted the shell of the facility is new and clean, but it is only an empty shell, but nothing works. Hotel is poorly ran with no customer service sense.This is more or less a time-share facility / condo not a luxury hotel. The hotel was a like ghost town. So I guess management did not feel the need to keep it well maintained at all hours. Goes to show how much business they get to skip on the bare essentials. WILL NOT EVEN RECOMMEND THIS PLACE TO MY WORST ENEMY. YOU WILL BE SEVERELY WASTING YOUR TIME AND FEELING STRESSED AND A SOUR TASTE IN YOUR MOUTH. TY.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience!”
Reviews.Author: n0rthland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Aldea Thai, unit 231 for 2 weeks over New Years. The unit itself was amazing. I loved the decor. Our 2 bedroom suite was right beside the pool, getting lounge chairs by the pool was never a problem. We had a huge terrace with our own private pool on it. When it was just too hot to be near the pool, the temperature on the terrace was perfect because of the ocean breeze. It was busy during the bpm Festival (DJ festival) but once it was over the crowds eased, the late night partiers disappeared and we were able to find chairs at the beach clubs! We tended to have breakfast in our room but enjoyed the walk along 5th Avenue in the evening checking out different restaurants. Other than our favorite "Ah Cacao" for an afternoon latte, we chose a different restaurant every night! I can't wait to return. We rented our unit from a private owner directly and we were absolutely happy with it.

Reviews.Title: “Timeshare Scam Artists!!!”
Reviews.Author: dj u
Reviews.Content: Like what a few people have already mentioned, we too were coaxed into a timeshare deal that we thought would be a great investment turns out to be very fraudulent. They said that they would rent out weeks we didn't want with Orchid Vacation Rentals and wire us the profits. We were supposed to get the papers for them to wire it to my bank account but still no response from them. This was in August 2011. I'm trying to figure out how to get our money back. We actually went in the next day to rescind the contract but they refused to give us our refund. We asked them time and time again about the catalog of hotels they said we would be able to travel to at discounted rates but none of these hotels are included. Now they are billing us and not returning our messages. I just filed a dispute with our credit card company to see what they can do to get us out of this debt trap. Any advice you can offer, please let me know. Message me if you've had similar experiences or know how to shut these dishonest crooks down!

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysOnAPlan
Reviews.Content: We stayed during Christmas 2011 and although we have stayed at Aldea Thai before and were a bit disappointed, we thought we'd give it another chance. Bad idea. This time, we had a 3 bedroom suite. All of them are very badly designed with a lot of wasted space and some 'spa-like' showers don't have a curtain around them. This time, there wasn't enough cutlery for us (but 9 knives, go figure), or pots to even boil water. The concierge didn't respond to our requests. You get two bars of soap for 3 bathrooms, no refill on the one roll of papertowels, bad quality toilet paper and not enough towels. Even the hairdryer didn't work properly. We called 3 times about the A/C not functioning properly and once because they turned off the water in the entire unit for no reason. There was also no shade on our upstairs patio so we couldn't really use it in the heat. We also had to call at least 4-5 days to find out if the maid was even coming (after 4pm!). For the prices they charge, you really don't get all that much. Its also RIGHT on Mamitas beach so there is all night partying. If you have young kids, that can be a problem. Doubt we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “be very careful, good and bad here”
Reviews.Author: JimM
Reviews.Content: Aldea Thai is a condohotel, which means that each unit in the building has a different owner. There are a lot of good reasons to rent here, especially the location, but beware of who you rent from. You can rent a unit through the Mistik VIP service on the ground level. You will pay a premium but you can be sure that you will have a unit that is professionally managed and will only suffer from some modest design flaws of the architect/builder. But if you rent through an individual or a local rental service to get a better price then you are rolling the dice. Before I knew the difference, I took the second option and got screwed by the owner of unit #303, Carla Hammeken and her local agent, Oscar Lloyd. We arrived at the designated 1pm time and were not given keys until 3pm. We entered and found a three bedroom penthouse suite that had not been cleaned in the two weeks since the last tropical storm. There was mildew on every surface of the unit. By 9pm they had one bedroom clean. Two days later, when the rest of our family arrived, the whole place was clean but we lacked a full set of cutlery, plates and cooking pans. The clean water dispenser was broken. There was neither toilet paper nor paper towels. There were not enough bath nor beach towels for six adults. Half of the interior lights were dead (I had to buy light bulbs and re-wire two lamps to get adequate lights for the living room). Seven out of eight roof deck lights were dead, as was the circulating pump in our private pool. There were no tables and torn furniture cushions on the deck After six days of complaints we were finally given a few mis-matched towels but no other problems were addressed. I asked for a refund of some of our payment but the agent, Oscar Lloyd, refused. Later, he was sufficiently indiscreet to complain by email to another local realtor who is a friend, saying that we were being unreasonable. What is truly unforgivable is that we made this reservation three months ago so there was no mistake about when we would arrive in order to meet minimal expectations. They did not care about us once they had our money, $3500 for ten days. They even had sent us pictures taken of a different unit. Once they have your money you are out of luck. Do not do business with these charlatans. Try Lilia Muller at Playa Tulum Realty who is fabulous, or Bric, with whom I have had good dealings.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Alex V
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great Location, Kitchen, Services, Pool and access to Kool Beach Club Cons: Overpriced, Loud during high season but Nice and Quiet during low season, it doesnt have a good restaurant or a food service what so ever, but it has an Oxxo (convenient store) a few steps away and a nice sea food restaurant in 1st floor... also its 1 block away from 5a ave wich is THE place to be in Playa del Carmen

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled. NOT a good find.”
Reviews.Author: paul j
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Nov. 2011 and had a poor experience. It's rented out through Bric Vacation Rentals so we had to check in at a main location as they have many propeties in Playa. We were assigned a personal concierge who we could call anytime for anything. Sounded great but was very unreliable. We stayed in a Penthouse and expected as much. Our rooftop view to the ocean was great except the rooftop terrace next to us was very unkept. Moldy cusions pilled up and maintenence equiptment out. The entire complex had a worn feel to it. Lots of paint chipping and holes in the drywall. There was a dead bird by one of the main stairways that layed there for more than a day before one of the staff removed it. As we swam in the main pool, a broken fan repeatedly hit a nearby beam making a loud noise. That went on for hours. There was a broken light bulb by the only elevator. That took 5 phone calls and 2 trips to the front desk (3 days) to fix. We had a broken towel bar the first day. Hair dryer broken too. The shower set up was a joke. No curtain on a raised spa type shower so the floor got flooded the first day. We used a couple towels to clean it up but they were not replaced the following day because it's their policy to change towles on the 3rd day. We spent 4 nights in Tulum first so when we arrived in Playa we were nearly out of clean clothes. We were told they would set up a laundry service but we didn't get our clothes back until our final day in Playa. It was just one thing after another. Upon our return, I contacted the person who I booked the vacation with. I explained the situation and was told they would compensate me for all the problems we had. I never asked for compensation but it was offered. I just wanted them to know about our poor experience. I have yet to be contacted by their management for any sort of compensation or any sort of explanation or apology. I had high expectations from a property listed as a penthouse and told it was one of their best proprties. I was comletely let down. I would be very cautious if you book anything through Bric Vacation Properties.

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend this place enough”
Reviews.Author: Tine_Babiarz
Reviews.Content: We rented condo 205, which I think is called Studio Patriza, through Teamoplaya, Vacation rentals and got a great deal for an 8 day stay in the beginning of August, after having lived in a more modest place in Tulum for a week, which of course has a certain effect on our evaluation and rating of the place. We were asked to pay a rather big deposit which troubled me a little, but there was no problem at check out: We got our deposit back without any hassle. The condo is huge and has a big bathroom with hair dryer and iron board, a well-equipped, totally new kitchen, a bedroom with a comfortable bed and finally a small, cosy balcony with partial ocean view. You can't sit on the balcony in the morning because it's way to hot (it's placed on the sunny side of the building), but that's really details. The furniture and chosen colours of the room are really appealing to the eye, and the same is the case for the rest of the building (the pool, reception, out door areas). On the downside you could say that the 'thai theme' is a bit unauthentic (I want to feel that I'm in Mexico : ) ) or at least unnecassary. The location is great, although the beach in this part of Playa del carmen is a bit crowded and primarily filled with young partying people who wants to be seen - we are talking lots of silicone boobs and italian guys showing off ; ) Remember that you can use the sun beds on the beah for free, when living at Aldea Thai, and also you get a rather big discount on beverages and food at the nearest restaurant on the beach (can't remember the name, sorry), but you'll have to ask yourself to get the discount. Overall a great experience with a luxury feel to it.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation option by far in the riviera!”
Reviews.Author: 5starrr
Reviews.Content: Visited mexico this summer with my parents, we were looking for investment options for a vacation condo, 2nd home in the Mayan Riviera, after looking at many apts, condos and timeshares. We realized the best value we could find was fractional ownership. So we visited a few...the concept just seems much smarter than average timeshare. So we came across the perfect place and deal! We fell in love with Aldea Thai immediately, an excellent program, very prestigious, exactly what I was looking for. Stunning interior, amazing decor, detail, quality and views, penthouse is very nice!!! Not to mention the private roof deck...private pool....what else can you ask for....im very impressed. Very upscale. And off course its the perfect location, has to be one of the best beach clubs and hottest beach ambiance i seen yet in all of Mexico. Our investment also allows us to visit similar private residence clubs all across the world,a fabulous collection of vacations I must admit, plus some very attractive cruises I planned anyway. extremely low maintenance fees! Very excited to use my membership, its definitely the best value I came across so far.Looking forward to more great times in the riviera in the near future! Very Sweet! Purchased in July. Im using my first week right now its my last day of my week. Sad to leave but excited to return in feb! See you again very soon Aldea Thai...thank you to Anastasia for all the information on fractional ownership and for a very attractive offer! You were great! Will definitely enjoy this for a lifetime. Highly recommended for a weekend stay or fractional ownership investment, you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis between third world countries”
Reviews.Author: SthOz
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel after trecking through Guatemala and low budget accomodation in Belize. It has everything your could want, close to the beach, great staff, clean, kitchen facilities and great views of Playa. If your heading to Playa dont hesitate to stay at this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “the hotel was excellent! New hotel, comfortable, clean, and oriental!”
Reviews.Author: mon2903
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband LOVE this modern beautiful hotel, great swimming pool! I think we booked by expedia (or something like that). The hotel is just right be the beach!!! we had a view on the ocean. It was really royal vacation for us! The hotel was very clean, the beds are new, we had a kitchen in the room. The beds are very exotic and the whole decor was oriental, and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible place, horrible people!”
Reviews.Author: elizka74
Reviews.Content: Just as the previous comments posted we were almost victims of this fraudulent company. We were also promised to get 4 weeks at the Aldea Thai resort and all sister resorts around the world. Once we signed the contracts we found out that all we really bought was a membership with Gold Crown Resorts. For $20K they sold us membership to a site that doesn’t even have the hotels that they told us about. UNBELIEVABLE! Thank God to nice people at our resort who told us about PROFECO, it’s a government body which is there to protect tourists and customers. We also learned that in Mexico you have the right to change your mind about any contract signed with is 5 days. With the help of PROFECO and the fact we were with in the 5 days we got our money back. All of it! I can not believe that people can lie to your face day in and day out and still be in business. What bothers me more then anything is that these liars are American and Canadian citizens ripping off other Americans and Canadians. How can you live with yourself knowing that you are taking money from hard working families? I hope Aldea Vacation Club and Gold Crown Resorts will go into bankruptcy and get shut down so they wont be able lie and take money from other hard working individuals.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for timeshare racket and rampant dishonesty!!”
Reviews.Author: Ty D
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been traveling to Playa del Carmen every year since 2006 and we love all things about Playa. In August 2011, we went to a timeshare presentation at Aldea Thai. The hotel itself appears to be beautiful and is in a great part of Playa. As a result, we were excited - as it turns out, we were foolish - when the sales person at Aldea Thai offered us a great price on a "resale" to assume the final set of payments for a widow who currently owns 4 fixed weeks at Aldea Thai. We signed the paperwork and, over the next few days, we were constantly checking our email to get our membership information so we could book a Thanksgiving stay at Aldea Thai. A week or so later, while we were still in Mexico, we received an email containing information about a Gold Crown Resort membership, which is apparently what we had been sold. As a previous reviewer mentioned, we could not find Aldea Thai on the Gold Crown Resort Website, at which time we went back to Aldea Thai to confront the folks who sold us our membership. After making a total of 4 in-person visits to Aldea Thai over the span of 2 days, during which time we were told a bunch of bold-faced lies by 4 different representatives of the hotel (including promises of a free Thanksgiving week stay at the hotel), we were finally told that we did not actually have any access to make reservations at the hotel. Even though we should have been more careful about accepting an offer which seemed too good to be true, the depth and breadth of the lies we were told during our numerous interactions with the folks at the hotel should serve as a strong word of caution for anyone who wants to buy or stay at the hotel. PLEASE BE VERY, VERY CAREFUL AND WARY!!

Reviews.Title: “Not customer friendly, never again!”
Reviews.Author: Deborah U
Reviews.Content: Our first room had a dead rat sort of smell that seemed to be coming from the a.c vents.Called for someone to come and check, waited for half an hour, then called again. Eventually a maintenance guy shows up with a plunger! He looks around cannot find anything. We also tell him about slime in the plunge pool. He then finds a plastic bag of rotting fish in the pool 's pump cupboard!! They also don't clean the pool veranda area either as there are cigarette butts and dried tea bags lying around. We continue to complain until they move us to another room. This other room still has a smell coming from the a.c, but we are too tired to make a fuss so we just cover our heads under the sheets and try to sleep. The next morning we decide to take a plunge in our pool, and there is dried vomit all over the ledge and side of the pool! Also more dried tea bags and cigarette butts! When we called to complain again, they kept saying they would send someone, but didn't, so we took photos and took it down to the front desk. They smiled and politely told us that it was not their fault, and condos were cleaned by different companies, and they would see what they could do! They took a day to sweep up the deck, then another day to clean. Or wipe off the dried vomit on the ledge of the pool, but left the side with it still stuck on !! We complained but to no avail, not even a discount, up-grade or refund was offered! Un believable! Even the tickets for free beach chairs and discounts on food and drinks at the beach club did not work, we still had to pay for everything on the beach too, !! We even bought plug in air fresheners for the rooms and left them there! ,hopefully the next person to rent that room will find it fresher! Would never stay ther again, poor customer service, it's like once they took your money they didn't,t care if you were satisfied or not! I feel bad for the actual condo owners because they are not keeping up the standard for what they must have paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great option at Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Terebv
Reviews.Content: We really loved our stay in this hotel. It is located just steps from the beautiful Playa Mamitas and a few blocks from the 5ta Avenida, close enough to walk there and get access to all the different options to shop, dine and party but far enough to enjoy a peaceful and silent night sleep. Hotel rooms are really nice and include a full kitchenette which is a great bonus in a place like Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Looks great, sounds aweful!!”
Reviews.Author: Audlang
Reviews.Content: Had an 8 night stay at the Hotel for First Time. Our First impression was really good,since everything looks amazing once you Go up The stairways. The ambiance is really calm and you get a good sense of it right away. Things Get bad at night. The music is louds at The beach clubs and The hallways are very echo. Clean is one good thing. Location is Ok. Service is just Ok. Mexico style! Rooms are very Nice. Go for The rooms with pools! Clean clean clean.....nothing bad to say. The site is beautiful. The pool is very Nice and you also Get an amzing breakfast at The Cool beach club! Poooooor on AC. It works one Day and not The next!

Reviews.Title: “Nice looking hotel with bunch of maintenance issues”
Reviews.Author: dacens
Reviews.Content: First impression of this hotel was - ohhh, it looks so beautiful. At the check in we were upgraded to nice room with living room, terrace and private pool. That far we were so happy. We notice AC doesn't work, notice on the table informed, that there wont be AC until 6pm. Ok, 6 past, 7, 8 ...still no air. 12am...nothing. Contacted front desk, maintenance guys came twice - still no air. We were offered to change the room, but, what a surprise, there is no AC also in other room!!!!! And we weren't only guests with this issue. Finlay, we moved 3rd time and then AC was ok, but very loud, but you can live with it - better then 85F:). Our safe was not possible twice - but maintenance came quick and resolve it. The same problem with door:(. And light in the bathroom and so on. It seems, that management tries to keep this place upscale, it even looks so, but there is so many issues, that next time we would stay somewhere else. Front desk was always very accommodating and king - great guys. Hotel is close to beach, but there is not hotel beach chairs, you need to rent it from Beach club Mamitas or Kool - but those places are crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to improve”
Reviews.Author: SusanMcK
Reviews.Content: What I liked: large, well-appointed rooms, very nice grounds with beautiful pools. Very clean. Nice kitchen in the room. What I didn't like so much: service was friendly but uneven. Cheap toilet seat broke and they weren't going to replace it until a day later--we had to insist because we had no toilet seat to sit on. One wing of hotel did not have hot water. We ran out of toilet paper and it took a while to get more. Noise travels effortlessly between connected rooms (rooms where a door could be opened up so that it is a two-room accommodation).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for mid 20s to 30s!”
Reviews.Author: dngrockstar
Reviews.Content: The resort was great! We stayed in a luxury suite during the BPM festival in January. I didn't expect a private pool to be included but ours had one. The rooms are spacious and with complete kitchen amenities. We had a partial view of the ocean as well as the side street that led to Kool Beach. Needless to say, this is the place to be if you want to party and be close to the beach. I didn't really notice the loud music, then again we were there to party so it didn't bother me. Because of the proximity to Kool Beach and Mamitas and considering the music they play and the volume they play it at, unless you like house or dance music, I wouldn't recommend staying here. If you like that kind of music, this is the place for you. It is a couple of blocks from 5th avenue, but nothing too inconvenient for a walk. Taxis were easy to find in the area. There are a couple restaurants below the resort on ground level as well as a liquor store just a few steps up the street. We inquired about breakfast and they directed us to Mamitas beach club just next door. Breakfast began at 8 am. Wi-Fi worked great in the rooms and were free with our room. All in all, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hope you like non-stop pounding music - the same loud beat all day long”
Reviews.Author: RedHawkDoc
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice in many ways. The staff was quite pleasant and tried to be helpful. The pool was large and very nice and uncrowded throughout our visit. The room was well appointed with tile floors and attractive furniture. The shower was great - lots of water pressure. We could see the ocean from our (small) balcony. The hotel is located close to the beach and a short walk to the heart of the town - restaurants, shops, etc. The TV worked well and the internet connection was good and free. Downside: The place next door is a beach bar that plays very loud from about 8:30am until after midnight. The pulsing beat was monotonous and penetrated every fiber of our beings all day long. There is little staff - they show a pool bar, but it was not always staffed. There is a concierge desk that was never staffed. The bed was rock hard. That may be good for some. I like a hard mattress, but this one took the cake. Did I mention the music? The balcony was small - no chairs or room for them. And there was only one small side chair in the room. And when the bar closed, some of the other residents in their rooftop patio played the same music non-stop all night long. A real bonus. There are really no amenities - no restaurant, etc. so you need to go off site for meals. So, if you are under 30 and want a non-stop party hotel, this is definitely the place. It is a party hotel. If you're not, and if you have kids, stay far away from this place. We saw one poor family with kids at the pool one day - that's it. If you're looking for relaxation and a luxury experience - keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury feel and awesome pool, missing some key comforts”
Reviews.Author: mkday
Reviews.Content: Aldea Thai feels like a high-end luxury resort when you walk through the common areas. Beautifully decorated and designed, very "zen", and the pool area is gorgeous, almost makes you not want to go to the beach a block away (but if you do, you get free use of Mamitas chairs and umbrellas, provided you get there early enough). Our room, however, although a great deal at $125, had such awful lighting you could barely read at night without squinting, and the shower got lukewarm 2min in to each shower over the course of the 3 days we were there. That said, Playa is warm, so water temp wasn't that impt, and we weren't in the room that much. Was definitely a great deal for the superior room, and I'd both come back and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! Going back soon!”
Reviews.Author: SarahMD55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Playa in February 2010 and stayed in a junior suite for 6 nights. It was after dark when we arrived and the hotel was very striking at night! Beautiful stairs, decor and lighting. We loved having a kitchen while staying here! We walked to Mega mart a couple of times for snacks and lunch items. We also made our own drinks often with fresh fruit juice from the local stands. When we first arrived we were pressured into booking excursions but we kindly declined and the staff left us alone after that. The front desk, security, maintenance people and housekeepers were all very friendly! The pool is gorgeous and we loved Mamitas beach. We also loved that the hotel is located out of the loudest part of downtown but only a quick walk to all the action. We can't wait to return this coming year!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing :)”
Reviews.Author: JetSettingDiva
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical about the place at first after reading some negative reviews, but after getting some reassurance from Stephanie (BRIC Agent) I knew everything would be fine. Our trip to PDC was to celebrate my sisters 30th birthday. When our large group arrived to Aldea, we were all amazed by the chic look of the place. When we walked into our 3bd/3bth penthouse, we were in awww. The penthouse was absolutely amazing and so modern. The rooftop was AWESOME. It was very spacious, scenic, and chic. The only complaint I would give about the rooftop is that if your group is loud and rowdy, like mine, you will get complaints from the "neighbors" who live there or staying there :( other than that everything else was GREAT:) The staff was very friendly and helpful. I'm so glad we stayed at Aldea Thai, despite some negativity from previous reviews. One cant go by what others comment or experience. This is one for the books. The place is a definite go.. ***A special "THANKS" to Fanny (BRIC) and our concierge Roberto (BRIC). The biggest "THANKS" to Stephanie (BRIC) who helped me out tremendously with the booking and planning of my sisters 30th Birthday event. Thank you all so much for all your help and courtesy throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Superior room = Maid's room”
Reviews.Author: alonsorr
Reviews.Content: We paid 90 dollars a night for a room that had a view to nothing with a shower head so low I had to bend over and the only comfort being a nice bed. The hotels has ABSOLUTELY no services whatsoever and no minibar or anything, not even a bottle of water in the morning. During our stay here the lift broke down, internet went off like every hour, the lock on the door had to be changed, they ran out of coupons for the beach, the airco didn't work, staff spoke minimal amount of English, even though friendly. Honestly it's too expensive for just a nice bed. Any other hotel on fifth avenue is half price and way better

Reviews.Title: “Exactly What I Needed”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why others didn't like this place. Their reasons mostly sound petty and self-righteous. I found the reception very welcoming - including sparkling wine and a cold cloth to wipe my face! And it was very relaxed (a la Mexico!). I was escorted to my room - very chic - Manhattan chic in a casual Thai setting. I was very happy with the room, the cleanliness, amenities of the room, huge bathroom, great water pressure in both the shower and the toilet.....closet space, television channels. It was just what I needed. I didn't go to Playa to spend all day and night in my room, though. So I searched the area - amazing 5 minutes to 5th Avenue - THE place to be in PDC. 4 minute walk to the beach - and the hotel offers a coupon for 50% off a lounge chair and 10% off all drinks/food! Exceptional! Really, Aldea Thai could have done nothing more to make me happier. And the pool is amazing. And the pool bar is even more amazing! Aye Aye! Love it Aldea Thai - I'll visit you again!

Reviews.Title: “Aldea anxieties alleviated”
Reviews.Author: WiFo_Washington
Reviews.Content: After reading some negative reviews, I kept returning to my Orbitz confirmation to be sure we had the "junior suite," with kitchen, balcony, etc. Indeed, that's what we got. The 'condo-tel' is pretty quiet, which was nice. The room was huge. The only problem was a sort of musty smell in the bathroom, but it was not constant. The staff was very friendly, attentive. We didn't hang out much near the Aldea end of Avenida 5ta, preferring to use the Mosquito Beach club, which was fantastic. If we return, we might actually try the Mosquito Beach Hotel. The room would likely be smaller, but the location more convenient. Also, for any lgbt travelers considering Aldea's proximity to Wana Bana Bar, be advised that it closed in 2007. Playa 69 is the only specifically gay venue.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay at Aldea Thai”
Reviews.Author: browneyes208
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I enjoyed our four night stay at Aldea Thai. I was a little anxious about my stay because of limited reviews and information, but all of those fears were alleviated once we arrived. We were greeted with a "hola" and two glasses of wine. Check in was a breeze and we were given the exact type of room we requested. The location is near perfect. The hotel sits directly in front of Mamitas Beach and is a quick walk to 5th avenue. If you are looking to be pampered, this is not for you. However, if you appreciate a chic hotel that has nicely appointed and clean rooms then you will enjoy Aldea Thai. They have a few things that they can add that will definitely increase the appeal of this property. All the staff are extremely helpful and friendly especially Karina and Gabriel. I loved the fact that we received personal greetings each time we arrived or left the hotel grounds. Also, the security out front is diligent in making sure that those who enter the hotel are guests or accompanied by guests. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “superior room----awful!!!”
Reviews.Author: mariiamontreal
Reviews.Content: The location is great (right near the beach), staff is friendly, the grounds are beautiful and clean but the superior 4star room definitely not worth it!!! Room faces indoors (had to ask to switch 2 times to finally get some natural light. The first room we were shown faced a dark indoor corridor inside the lobby. The second one faced an indoor stairway. Window doesn't open so room feels kind of humid. The superior room is really an adjoining room to the suites they offer. Our room did not have many of the amenities they claim (hairdryer...) we even had to wait while they installed and drilled in the safe after we told them there wasn't one in our room. There was also a loud constant buzzing sound 24hours a day, not sure from where but quite annoying to sleep. The suites looked much better, had we known. The Superior room truly not worth it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: kbn22
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Aldea Thai. There weren't many reviews when we booked our stay on Orbitz ($124/night), but we decided to take a chance, and I am so glad we did! The hotel itself is beautiful, with obviously new construction and cool Asian touches everywhere. And it's perfectly situated: at the northern tip of the tourist area, 2 blocks off of 5th - close enough to walk to everything on 5th or even into town, but completely peaceful at night. We found the service to be extremely friendly, from the valets to the concierge to the front desk. Gabriel was particularly helpful (and he's always there - we wondered if management ever gives him a day off!). We had only booked a King room (those are the small ones), but were graciously offered an upgrade to a larger double room with a pool view when we checked in. My only concern was the noise from the pool, but I needn't have worried - the window panes are so thick that you can't hear a peep from the outside, even when the pool bartender is playing music. The hotel has all the amenities that are so common in America but not always a given in a foreign country: free parking, free wireless, a hairdryer, etc. Our bathroom was large and we even had a little hallway area with lots of closet space. The hotel is less than a block from the beach, and the concierge can give you 50% off coupons for chairs and a palapa at Mamita's Beach Club (knocking the price down from 90 mx to 45 mx). The criticisms we had were all small and easily fixable, and I'm confident that as the hotel matures, some or all of these will be addressed: - In the bathroom: showers lack sufficient hot water (at full blast, you've got about 5 minutes), no shower soap is provided (just tiny facial soaps that work as hand soaps), and the sinks are more form than function (the previous reviewer was spot-on when he said the water gets all over the counter) - At the pool: I get that they don't want a silent pool area, but techno music at 2 pm (particularly at the volume the bartender plays) isn't what most tourists are looking for. Frank Sinatra/Tony Bennett (or even American top 40) would be better, and at a lower volume so that people can nap or read peacefully if they wish. Also, beach towels would be a really nice addition so that guests don't have to re-use the bath towels (I think beach towels are included in the high-end rooms, but not the others). - Not a grumble, just a suggestion: Even if a restaurant isn't possible, an onsite bar that would be available to guests in the evening would be a great addition. There's a beautiful lounge near check-in, but we didn't ever see anyone using it; we would have loved to grab drinks there before heading out for dinner. But of course, there are so many nearby bars and restaurants that the lack of one onsite is hardly a problem - it would just be nice to have. Given those very minor complaints, I suppose this is technically a 4.5 star review rather than a 5 star. But given the amazing price we paid, I felt that Aldea Thai more than exceeded our expectations. We are already thinking about when we can come back!

Reviews.Title: “We Are Easy To Please, But Do NOT Stay Here!!!”
Reviews.Author: JDC-HKK_Travels
Reviews.Content: I like writing reviews and love rewarding good service. However, the service at this place was horrible and they misrepresent themselves. I will mention pros and cons. Pros: 1) Place looks chic. Like a Thai spa. 2) The shared grounds are well kept and maintained. The glass is clean, the doors and lobby are clean. 3) The location two blocks from the beach, but Club Kool blocks direct access. 4) There is parking included in the room rate, which was important to us. 5) The maids were great and tried to go above and beyond. Cons: 1) We were given a room in the basement even though the hotel was empty. 2) The smell. The horrible smell. The bathroom had a drain built into the bottom, as many bathrooms do in Mexico, but the smell emanating from it smelled like horrible sewage. We could not breathe in the room. We kept the door closed. 3) The room rate advertises a DVD player. Our room did not have one. (We normally stay in budget locations without a TV or without other amenities, but we want what we pay for). When we went to speak to the receptionist about it, he did nothing the first night of our stay. We went again and asked why our room did not have the DVD player as per Expedia or their own data. They told us we were wrong. They did not even try to fix it nor even explain it - they just told us we were wrong. I speak fluent Spanish so I made sure what they said was what I was hearing in both English and Spanish. I told them I saw it on the website. They said we were wrong and that Expedia was wrong. I told them that they were the ones who put the information on Expedia and the room descriptions in the first place. They still were rude and not conciliatory at all. 4) The sewage pipe that runs through the underground parking leaked all over our rental car. 5) The in-room safe was completely broken and it took them 2 days to respond to our request. After they came, it was still broken. 6) The construction was poor. There were leaks and puddles everywhere. The electric outlets in the room did not work. There were cracks in the ceiling. (We could deal with this in a low budget, older hotel, but this hotel was constructed in 2009). 7) Please note that the hotel was empty and there were only three other rooms filled when we were there. We went on vacation during a busy time of year. 8) The main objective of Aldea Thai is to sell rooms and not be a hotel or have common customer service. This is not a good hotel and should not be used as one. There are so many wonderful options in Playa del Carmen. The whole Maya Riviera is great. I have been to the Yucatan three times in the past few years (twice this year). We are going back to the Yucatan in two days! After having stayed in low end hostels in the region and 4 star hotels throughout Mexico, this hotel was truly disappointing and not as advertised. Pick one of the way better options available in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Siblings trip!!”
Reviews.Author: bortonoverseas
Reviews.Content: What a unique place. Very 5 star, the pool, the pools around the resort all very zen!! Loved our penthouse condo, we lived on the top ( roof) comfortable seating and private pool.
